alert.note: Alert for Chouteau; Eastern Pondera; Eastern Teton; Hill; Liberty; Toole (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 09 at 5:13PM MDT by NWS GreatFalls
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southeastern Pondera, Liberty, southeastern Toole, east central Teton, western Hill and northwestern Chouteau Counties through 600 PM MDT... At 513 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 30 miles northwest of Joplin to 8 miles south of Lothair to 14 miles south of The Knees. Movement was east at 40 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Fort Benton, Chester, Joplin, The Knees, Inverness, Lothair, Power, Carter, Hingham, Floweree, Rudyard and Tiber Dam. This includes the following highways... Highway 2 between mile markers 308 and 348. Highway 87 between mile markers 19 and 49. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 1000 PM MDT for north central Montana.
